segments.text: As I watch the scene, I feel like I'm a fly on the wall, just observing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is so engrossed in her task, it’s almost a little comical.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But then I see the puddle growing closer to her foot, and that’s when my heart sinks.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s like a ticking time bomb, and she’s completely unaware.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the boy climbing the stool – how reckless he looks!
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His hand is deep in the cookie jar; what is he thinking?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a pang of irritation at how oblivious everyone seems to be.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That girl, with her hand raised, looks so innocent, yet she’s part of the mischief.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s like a perfect storm of chaos, and I'm just waiting for it to explode.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The outside world looks so inviting, and I can’t help but feel envious of the peace it holds.
segments.speaker: PAR
